image.altText: Shot of teenage boy in park in front of tree

props.synopsis: Kian Guerreiro’s family thought his crushing fatigue was due to puberty. They never imagined the active teenager was fighting off melioidosis.

title.children: Deadly bacteria found in the dirt almost claimed teen's life

image.altText: NT Acting Coroner, Judge Elisabeth Armitage, sitting at a desk inside an office and reading papers in a file.

props.synopsis: The NT coroner has examined the history of two Aboriginal women killed by their partners, finding "systemic failings" in police's response to dozens of violent incidents preceding their deaths.

title.children: Coroner probes police actions in lead-up to DV deaths of two Darwin women

image.altText: Cane toad

props.synopsis: Kitted out with torches, gloves and buckets, hundreds of 'toad busters' will go on the hunt for a dangerous invader across northern Australia this week.

title.children: 'Toad busters' take up the fight against deadly pest in northern Australia

image.altText: Rain falls over a dry red plain.

props.synopsis: Heavy rain is predicted for the Pilbara as a cyclone forms off WA. Weather authorities are warning coastal communities from Port Hedland to Exmouth could be facing strong winds and heavy rain for the next few days.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Sean warning upgraded as it travels down WA coast

image.altText: A silhouette of a pregnant woman outside.

props.synopsis: A national Aboriginal children's advocacy body is calling on the NT government not to proceed with changes to child protection law that aim to make it easier for courts to place Indigenous children in non-Indigenous placements.

title.children: Planned changes to NT child protection law branded 'discriminatory'

image.altText: Exterior of pizza shop with sunset in background

props.synopsis: A summer police operation in the small NT town of Katherine has led to 200 arrests in just six weeks.

title.children: Almost 200 arrested over six-week police blitz in NT outback town

image.altText: An illegal fishing boat burns

props.synopsis: The Australian Border Force has intercepted three foreign fishing vessels and arrested 18 crew members in the latest illegal fishing boat incursion into northern waters.

title.children: Three foreign fishing boats intercepted off NT amid 'unprecedented surge'

image.altText: A shadowed figure behind a fence

props.synopsis: As prisoner numbers in the Northern Territory continue to climb, room in the prisons is running out. A facility dedicated to some of the most vulnerable inmates is now being used to house general population prisoners.

title.children: Calls for ‘urgent review’ of treatment of NT's mentally ill prisoners

image.altText: Donald Trump in suit pumps fist as crowd looks on

props.synopsis: Donald Trump lands in Washington, DC ahead of a pre-inauguration rally. Follow live.

title.children: 'We like winning': Trump takes victory lap at inauguration-eve rally

image.altText: A woman holds a hot water bottle against her stomach.

props.synopsis: A new study has found almost four in five Australian women have experienced problematic periods in the past five years, and almost half of those have missed days of work or study, costing about $14 billion a year in lost productivity.

title.children: Periods in spotlight as research highlights personal and economic cost

image.altText: two men holding a scout drone which is part of a research project for the anu to find new ways to fight fires

props.synopsis: With wildfires raging across Los Angeles, focus is turning to how new technologies, including AI, can aid our response to future disasters,. But there are concerns Australia isn't ready to combat fires all year round.

title.children: Experts warn Australia 'doesn't have tools' to fight large bushfires

image.altText: Photo of health service sign

props.synopsis: A group of doctors outraged by last year's abortion ban at Orange hospital in regional NSW say they have lodged a complaint with the state's corruption watchdog.

title.children: 'We are heartbroken and incensed': Doctors demand action after Orange abortion ban

image.altText: A woman with dark hair against a white background

props.synopsis: As the mystery and intrigue deepen, millions of Indians want to know: What hope is there, truly, that Nimisha Priya might be spared?

title.children: An Indian nurse killed a man in Yemen. His family will determine her fate

image.altText: Novak Djokovic speaks to the media at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Channel Nine host Tony Jones apologises for a comment — labelled "insulting and offensive" by Novak Djokovic — that prompted the 24-time major winner to boycott on-court interviews.

title.children: Nine host apologises after Novak Djokovic's interview boycott

image.altText: Alex de Minaur looks on during his Australian Open third round match.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur is bidding to reach his first Australian Open quarterfinal, however, talented Alex Michelsen isn't going to make his assignment easy.

title.children: De Minaur aiming for Aus Open first but lanky American stands in his way

image.altText: A big red-brown rock in front of a cloudy sky.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners in western Victoria say a draft management plan for Mt Arapiles-Tooan State Park has re-ignited racial abuse and harassment of Aboriginal people online and in the community.

title.children: Aboriginal people say Mt Arapiles climbing ban has sparked racist backlash

image.altText: A woman cries in front of a car.

props.synopsis: Two leading lawyers and a juror reveal what goes on behind the scenes of a high-profile murder trial, as Victoria's Supreme Court prepares for the Erin Patterson triple-murder case later this year.

title.children: 'Did she do it?': Jurors to answer key question of the mushroom cook case

image.altText: A black and white image of a man in military uniform.

props.synopsis: Late civil rights leader Marcus Garvey is one of five people Joe Biden has pardoned the day before Donald Trump's inauguration.

title.children: Biden pardons civil rights leader Marcus Garvey posthumously

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A rusted out shipwreck in the ocean with a small island in the background

props.synopsis: HMAS Protector, crumbling offshore of Heron Island, played an important part in Australia's naval history and is now a marine paradise providing security for fish, turtles, rays, and sharks.

title.children: HMAS Protector, bought for just 10 pounds, now a marine paradise off Heron Island

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX  is poised to rise 0.3 per cent this morning after Wall Street ended the week with a strong rally. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set to lift after Wall Street rally

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Trump's multi-billion-dollar meme coin roller coast heading down and fast!

image.altText: Close up of flat white in coffee cup with $5.50 in change

props.synopsis: Industry insiders say coffee lovers — even in regional Australia — are unlikely to escape paying more for their flat whites as cafes are forced to push up prices.

title.children: Flat white price likely to skyrocket this year, no matter where you live

image.altText: Shot of teenage boy in park in front of tree

props.synopsis: Kian Guerreiro’s family thought his crushing fatigue was due to puberty. They never imagined the active teenager was fighting off melioidosis.

title.children: A deadly bacteria found in dirt almost claimed teen's life

image.altText: Generic blue and white NSW Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: A man has been charged with the murder of a 48-year-old man who was found critically injured at a unit in Sydney's north-west.

title.children: Man charged with murdering another man in Sydney's north-west

image.altText: Carlos Alcaraz looks annoyed, holding his head in his hands with a towel

props.synopsis: The US ban of TikTok has some feeling glum, while a hot-temper in the Aussie heat has burnt a hole in Medvedev's pocket. Here are the five quick hits from day eight of the Australian Open.

title.children: Quick hits: 'Crazy' clocks, TikTok turmoil and racquet smashing fines

image.altText: A newborn turtle is held in someone's hand.

props.synopsis: A new online tool will help conservationist share and compare novel solutions to climate threats. Its founders hope it will inspire innovation and optimism amid grim global warming metrics.

title.children: New tool has given conservationists hope amid warming climate

image.altText: A great white shark looking at the camera almost looking like its smiling with its mouth open.

props.synopsis: While scientists say increasing electronic monitoring of white sharks across South Australia's coastline could help warn beachgoers of imminent danger, the state government has other ideas.

title.children: Scientists back acoustic tagging of sharks as part of wider warning system for SA

image.altText: The Tomago aluminium plant near Newcastle.

props.synopsis: Federal Labor will offer billions of dollars in production credits to support a new "green aluminium" sector, in a new election pitch.

title.children: Albanese government promises $2 billion for new 'green aluminium' sector

image.altText: Aerial photo of a group of people by a river.

props.synopsis: Protesters call for a shake-up of Western Australia's fire management practice, but others point to the tragic outcomes of the Los Angeles fires as a cautionary tale.

title.children: Protest calls for end to prescribed burns in old-growth forests

image.altText: A black and silver book with the title Onyx Storm featuring dragon motifs cut out against a lilac and pink background.

props.synopsis: The third book in the bestselling Empyrean series is finally out tomorrow, but not everyone has bought into the Fourth Wing hype. What can we expect from Onyx Storm and is there anything to the criticism of the series and its author, Rebecca Yarros?

title.children: Equal parts popular and controversial, the next Fourth Wing book is almost here

image.altText: Stuart O'Grady sits out the top of a team car

props.synopsis: Stuart O'Grady says despite all his race wins and Olympic, world and Commonwealth gold medals, welcoming the world's top UCI pro cyclists to his backyard for the Tour Down Under is his proudest moment.

title.children: Why running the Tour Down Under is Stuart O'Grady's proudest achievement

image.altText: Sarah and Tom engagement

props.synopsis: For Brisbane couple Tom Morrey and Sarah O'Leary, an old brooch became the engagement ring of their dreams after the suggestion to repurpose a family heirloom.

title.children: New jewellery is falling out of fashion for young couples

image.altText: Sun high in the sky, people walk in park.

props.synopsis: South-east and central Queensland will start the week "quite cool" according to the weather bureau before forecast temperatures are tipped to reach 38 degrees Celsius in Brisbane and on the Sunshine Coast.

title.children: Brief reprieve for Queensland ahead of more heatwave conditions

image.altText: Elderly lady and man with a beard, sitting at bench with a cup of tea and ipad, looking at camera

props.synopsis: Ageing boomers, a nursing shortage, and a federal capital works system labelled as a "lottery" are forcing some older residents to separate from their families, some regional aged care providers say.

title.children: Aged care residents forced to find a bed hundreds of kilometres away from home
